author: Admin
title: Alleged cyber-criminal wanted for fraud
text:
Alleged cyber-criminal wanted for fraud 
By GIFT NDOLWANE 
JOHANNESBURG, (CAJ News) – THE South African Police Service (SAPS) has opened a fraud case against suspected Zimbabwe cybercriminal, Benjamin Tsvuura. 
This follows Tsvuura’s alleged illegal placement of personal Google ADSense ID on the Centre for African Journalists (CAJ News) websites without their knowledge of the publishers. 
Police confirmed they wanted to question the suspect, who is also wanted for theft. 
Contacted for comment, CAJ News Chief Executive Officer, Savious Kwinika, confirmed opening a case of both fraud and theft against the accused person. 
Earlier on, when Tsvuura was reached for comment, he threatened journalists. 
He is also being accused of intruding into CAJ News emails and hacking the company’s websites. 
– CAJ News
